content:
nf-core Demo Pipeline: Learning & Testing

Your Gateway to nf-core Workflows

The nf-core demo pipeline is a simple, educational bioinformatics workflow designed specifically for workshops, training sessions, and pipeline testing. It demonstrates core nf-core principles and best practices while being fast enough to run in minutes.

What Does This Pipeline Do?

The demo pipeline performs basic quality control and sequence processing on FASTQ files:

  1. FastQC - Comprehensive quality control checks on raw sequencing data

  2. seqtk - Fast and lightweight sequence processing (trim/subsample)

  3. MultiQC - Aggregated HTML report with interactive visualizations

Why Use the Demo Pipeline?

Perfect for Learning

  • Quick execution: Completes in minutes, not hours

  • Simple workflow: Easy to understand pipeline structure

  • Well-documented: Extensive comments and documentation

  • nf-core standards: Demonstrates best practices

Ideal for Testing

  • Platform validation: Test Nextflow/nf-core installation

  • Container testing: Verify Docker/Singularity configuration

  • Resource testing: Check compute environment setup

  • CI/CD pipelines: Lightweight test for deployment workflows

Great for Workshops

  • Interactive learning: Modify parameters and see results quickly

  • Troubleshooting practice: Safe environment to debug issues

  • Minimal resources: Runs on laptops and small clusters

  • Real bioinformatics tools: Uses production-grade software

Pipeline Components

FastQC - Quality Control

FastQC is the industry standard for sequencing quality assessment:

  • Per base sequence quality scores

  • Per sequence quality scores

  • Sequence duplication levels

  • Adapter content detection

  • GC content distribution

  • Sequence length distribution

  • Overrepresented sequences

seqtk - Sequence Processing

seqtk is a fast toolkit for processing FASTA/FASTQ:

  • Sequence trimming and filtering

  • Format conversion

  • Subsampling for testing

  • Quality score manipulation

  • Handles gzip-compressed files natively

MultiQC - Unified Reporting

MultiQC creates beautiful, interactive reports:

  • Single HTML file for all samples

  • Interactive plots and tables

  • Software version tracking

  • Pipeline execution statistics

  • Customizable reports

Input Requirements

The pipeline requires a CSV samplesheet with three columns:

Samplesheet Format

  • sample (Required): Custom sample name. Spaces will be converted to underscores. Use the same name for multiple sequencing runs from the same sample.

  • fastq_1 (Required): Full path to Read 1 FASTQ file. Must be gzipped with .fastq.gz extension. Can be a local file path or remote URL.

  • fastq_2 (Optional): Full path to Read 2 FASTQ file. Must be gzipped with .fastq.gz extension. Leave blank for single-end data.

Example Samplesheet

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2
SAMPLE1_PE,https://example.com/sample1_R1.fastq.gz,https://example.com/sample1_R2.fastq.gz
SAMPLE2_PE,/path/to/sample2_R1.fastq.gz,/path/to/sample2_R2.fastq.gz
SAMPLE3_SE,/path/to/sample3_R1.fastq.gz,
CONTROL_REP1,s3://bucket/control_R1.fastq.gz,s3://bucket/control_R2.fastq.gz
TREATED_REP1,/data/treated_R1.fastq.gz,/data/treated_R2.fastq.gz

Samplesheet Requirements

  • File Format: CSV with header row

  • Mixed Data Types: Can include both single-end and paired-end samples in the same sheet

  • Multiple Runs: Multiple rows can have the same sample name (e.g., technical replicates or different sequencing lanes)

  • File Compression: All FASTQ files must be gzipped

  • Remote Files: Supports HTTP/HTTPS URLs and cloud storage paths (S3, GCS, etc.)

  • Validation: Pipeline will validate samplesheet format and file existence

Output Files

FastQC Results

  • fastqc/ - Individual FastQC HTML reports and ZIP files per sample

  • Quality plots for each FASTQ file

  • Detailed metrics and statistics

seqtk Output

  • seqtk/ - Processed FASTQ files

  • Trimmed or filtered sequences

  • Processing logs

MultiQC Report

  • multiqc/multiqc_report.html - Comprehensive QC summary

  • multiqc/multiqc_data/ - Raw data for custom analysis

  • Interactive plots comparing all samples

Pipeline Information

  • pipeline_info/ - Execution reports, timeline, DAG visualization

  • Software versions used

  • Resource usage statistics

Learning Objectives

Running this pipeline teaches you:

  1. nf-core structure: Understand how nf-core pipelines are organized

  2. Parameter usage: Learn to customize pipeline behavior

  3. Input formats: Master samplesheet creation

  4. Output interpretation: Read and understand QC reports

  5. Container usage: See containerization in action

  6. Resource management: Observe computational requirements

  7. Error handling: Practice troubleshooting in a safe environment

Use Cases

Educational

  • Workshops: Teach Nextflow and nf-core fundamentals

  • Training courses: Introduce bioinformatics workflows

  • Self-learning: Explore pipeline development

Testing & Development

  • Environment validation: Verify cluster/cloud setup

  • Profile testing: Test institutional configurations

  • CI/CD integration: Lightweight pipeline for automated testing

  • Container testing: Validate Docker/Singularity environments

Quick QC

  • Data quality checks: Fast assessment of FASTQ quality

  • Sequencing validation: Verify data before full analysis

  • Troubleshooting sequencing: Diagnose quality issues

Built on nf-core Best Practices

This pipeline demonstrates:

  • Modular design with reusable components

  • Comprehensive documentation

  • Containerized tools for reproducibility

  • Automatic resource management

  • Continuous integration testing

  • Version-controlled software

  • Community-driven development

Technical Details

Pipeline version: 1.0.1

Minimum requirements:

  • Nextflow >= 23.04.0

  • 2 CPU cores

  • 4 GB RAM

  • 10 GB disk space

Execution time: 5-10 minutes for test dataset

Maintained by: nf-core community (Chris Hakkaart, Geraldine Van der Auwera, Florian Wuennemann)

Next Steps After Demo

Once comfortable with this pipeline, explore:

  • nf-core/rnaseq - RNA sequencing analysis

  • nf-core/chipseq - ChIP-seq peak calling

  • nf-core/atacseq - ATAC-seq chromatin accessibility

  • nf-core/sarek - Variant calling from WGS/WES

  • nf-core/scrnaseq - Single-cell RNA-seq

Perfect for: Learning Nextflow • Testing nf-core • Workshop training • Platform validation • Quick QC checks • Pipeline development

Built with Nextflow • Powered by nf-core/demo v1.0.1 • Containerized execution • Continuous integration tested
